subject: Re: [junit] Unit 4.0 release candidate 2 Test ordering
msgSnippet: ... Very poetic, but still doesn t make a whole lot of sense to me :-) You just said it yourself:  when you see 1001 tests failed, you know it s actually only
messageBody:
On 1/21/06, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
> When I see 1001 tests failed, I know I should be
> looking at the forest. When I see 1 test failed I know I should look at
> the tree.


Very poetic, but still doesn't make a whole lot of sense to me :-)

You just said it yourself: when you see 1001 tests failed, you know it's
actually only 1 test that failed and it took down the other 1000.

Wouldn't it be nice if the framework told you exactly *which* test failed
instead of you having to pin down which test starts the Web server or which
tests opens a JDBC connection among thousands?

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
